obsinfo.main package

obsinfo.main.makeStationXML module

Main functions for obsinfo-makeStationXML

Creates obsinfo objects starting with a network object in a hierarchy which strongly follows the hierarchy of StationXML files. Then converts the objects to a StationXML file using obspy.

obsinfo.main.makeStationXML.get_first_author(info_dict)

Get info file first author info and return it in a string.

Used to fill the author attribute in the Inventory object of obspy.

Parameters

  • info_dict – The name to use.

  • state (bool.) – Current state to be in.

Returns

str – first author first name and last name and contact information

obsinfo.main.makeStationXML.init_logging()

Create or open a rotating logging file and add it to ObsinfoConfiguration

Returns

object of Logger class

obsinfo.main.makeStationXML.main(argv=None, dp=None)

Entry point for obsinfo-makeStationXML.

  1. Setups status variables from command line arguments.

  2. Read yaml or jason file invoking read_info_file, which returns a dictionary. Optionally validates dictionary schema.

  3. Creates obsinfo objects starting from network object from the dictionary

  4. Converts these to StationXML using obpsy libraries.

Manages all uncaught exceptions.

Parameters

  • argv (list) – list of command-line arguments to pass to ArgumentParser. If None, will use sys.argv

  • dp (Datapath) – Datapath object specifying where to look for files. If None, will use values specified in .obsinforc

obsinfo.main.makeStationXML.retrieve_arguments(argv, datapath)

Retrieve arguments from command line. Setup several status variables and get information file name

Parameters

  • argv (list) – command line arguments. If None, uses sys.argv

  • datapath (Datapath) – Object containing paths to find repository files, read from .obsinforc

Returns

All status variables and the information file name.

Return type

args (NameSpace)

obsinfo.main.print module

Application to testing and printing obsinfo information files.

Includes class TestObsinfo, class JsonRefTest and entry points.

# JsonRefTest tests the reading functions of JSON and YAML files.

# TestObsinfo tests information files content

Much the SAME functions and methods are called whether printing or testing, as there is little difference between both functionalities. Entry points vary for each functionality and the distinction is achieved by naming the executable with two different names (i.e. a named link):

  • obsinfo-print has entry point print_obs.

  • obsinfo-test has entry point run_suite_info_files. It is meant to be used by developers. In this vein, contrary to obsinfo-validate, obsinfo-print calls private methods which are not callable from the command line but which can be called from the interpreter.

  • JsonRefTest is meant to be called from the interpreter. It has no entry point.

There are two types of testing functionalities.

  1. If the file name includes “test–attributes” the output of the corresponding obsinfo test function will be checked against data contained in this class.

  2. If the file name is “normal”, it will simply run through to make sure there are no errors

Testing for type (a) uses data from obsinfo/tests/data/Information_Files/responses/_filters. Testing for type (b) uses data from obsinfo/_examples/Information_Files

WARNING: many tests are critically dependent on file hierarchy, including names. Do not change names in tests or _examples hierarchy, or else change the names here. Also, the following methods use four specific file names:

  • test_all_stage_types()

  • test_sensor()

  • test_preamplifier()

  • test_datalogger()

  • test_station()

All current examples of sensors safe NANOMETRICS_T240_SINGLESIDED have no configuration key and no default. Messages to this effect are to be expected.

class obsinfo.main.print.JsonRefTest(methodName='runTest')

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Class of test methods for information file format

Attributes:

  • testing_path (str): path to datafiles to be tested aside from the examples

  • level (str): level to be printed

  • test (boolean): determines if this is test mode

  • print_output (boolean): determines if this is print mode. Both can coexist.

The test file as an $ref to a file that doesn’t exist, a field that is not specified in the the schema, and lacks a field required in the schema

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Test suite and print methods for obsinfo operations.

Attributes:

  • infofiles_path (str): path to datafiles to be tested

  • level (str): level to be printed

  • test (boolean): determines if this is test mode

  • print_output (boolean): determines if this is print mode. Both can coexist.

setUp(test=True, print_output=False, level=None)

Set up default values and paths

Param

test - Invoke class methods in test mode, i.e. invoke assertions as well as obsinfo object creation

Param

print_output - Invoke class methos in print mode, no assertions.

Param

level - In print mode, determine up to which level information will be printed

test_all_components()

Test all information files in each components directory.

test_all_filters()

Test all information files in both examples and test/data/Information_Files/_filters” subdirectory If you wish to test individual files, use test_filter(file) with file an absolute or relative file name.

test_all_instrumentations()

Test all information files in instrumentation directory

test_all_networks()

Test all information files in network directory

test_all_stages()

Test all information files in each responses subdirectory.

test_change_modifications()

Test all possible channel modification and response modification labels

Uses several test network information files plus a test instrumentation file in _examples. Rationale for each assertEqual is given in the test information files themselves

The five first tests check channel modification labels and their priorities. The last one checks response_modifications

WARNING: Depends critically on the expected values of information files. If these change, tests will fail.

  • channel 0 - 3-00

  • channel 1 - H-00

  • channel 2 - H-01

  • channel 3 - 3-02

test_datalogger_configurations()

Test all configurations of a particular datalogger example

Will not test case 1 in test_sensor_configurations as it is common code. Will test what happens if configuration is not found or is empty.

WARNING: Depends critically on the expected values of information files. If these change, tests will fail.

test_preamp_configurations()

Test all configurations of particular preamp examples

Will not test case 1 in test_sensor_configurations as it is common code. Will test what happens if configuration is not found or is empty.

WARNING: Depends critically on the expected values of information files. If these change, tests will fail.

test_sensor_configurations()

Test cases for configurations of particular sensor examples

Will test what happens if no default is specified, if a default is specified and if default is overridden

WARNING: Depends critically on the expected values of information files. If these change, tests will fail.

obsinfo.main.print.print_obs()

Entry point for obsinfo-print. Print an information file according to its type, and levels below up to the specified level.

Captures all exceptions

obsinfo.main.setupObsinfo module

Application to configure variables used by obsinfo in file .obsinforc and to copy examples and templates out of the distribution directories

obsinfo.main.setupObsinfo.build_datapath_list(args, remote_repository)

Build datapath as a list of directories to search, similar to the PATH environment variable.

  1. Add working_directory as first option if it exists

  2. Next add local repository first if it exists (wll be first if no working directory specified)

  3. Finally add destination, where standard examples lie. This won’t be used if -x is on

  4. Final directory will be the remote one unless -v (invert) is specified

obsinfo.main.setupObsinfo.retrieve_arguments()

Parse command line arguments

Returns

dictionary of arguments, both status and directory names

obsinfo.main.setupObsinfo.setup_obsinfo()

Entry point for application to configure variables used by obsinfo in file .obsinforc and to copy examples and templates out of the distribution directories

obsinfo.main.setupObsinfo.validate_arguments(args)

Validate that directories in command line arguments exist. Raise an exception if not.

Parameters

args (dictionary of strings) – directory with command line argument, but status and directories

:raises OSError, ValueError

obsinfo.main.validate module

Main functions for obsinfo-validate.

obsinfo strongly follows the hierarchy of StationXML files.

Module contains both class ValidateObsinfo and a main entry point for obsinfo-validate

Sets up status variables according to .obsinforc and command line arguments.

Parameters

  • verbose (bool) – Print several progress messages

  • remote (bool) – Find file in command line argument using datapath

  • debug (bool) – Print more detailed messages and enable traceback of exceptions

Returns: self

validate_all_components()

Validate all information files in each components (sensor, preamplifier, datalogger) subdirectory as given by datapath

validate_all_filters()

Validate all information files in <component>/responses/_filters” subdirectory, as given by datapath.

If you wish to test individual files, use test_filter(file) with file an absolute or relative file name.

validate_all_instrumentations()

Validate all information files for instrumentations in a directory given by datapath

If you want to validate a single instrumentation file use validate_instrumentation.

validate_all_networks()

Validate all network information files in a directory.given by datapath

validate_all_stages()

Validate all information files in each responses subdirectory “<component>/responses/_filters”

If you wish to test individual files, use test_stage(file) with file an absolute or relative file name.

obsinfo.main.validate.main()

Entry point for obsinfo-validate.

  1. Setups status variables from command line arguments.

  2. Validates file according to file type contained in name

  3. Manages all uncaught exceptions
